Body:
Description: Hi Support,

We’ve received the following critical alert from our Endpoint Protector appliance:

“Your appliance is on critical low disk space, there is only 5.8 GB free available from 446.21 GB (1%). EPP Server functionality and performance may be severely affected. Use Audit Log Backup to reduce the logs stored in the database, delete older system and audit log backups, and tune policies to reduce incoming log count. For further assistance contact Support. You will be automatically logged out in 3 minutes.”

We’ve attempted to take action as suggested, but we’re running into several issues:

The application hangs or becomes unresponsive when attempting to back up or delete older shadow files.

When performing a log backup with the option to include shadow files, the resulting .gz backup files are smaller than expected, which raises concerns that data might be missing or not included properly.

Can you assist us in:

- Diagnosing why the backup process hangs or fails when managing shadow files?

- Verifying whether the shadow files are being properly included in our backups?

- Guiding us on safely clearing space without risking data loss?

We’d appreciate your help resolving this as soon as possible given the critical state of the system.

Best,
Philip
What We've Learned Updated: Disc space
Next Steps Updated: Scheduel a remote connection.
Invitation updated. Attendees: Iosif Muntean, Flaviu Moldovan, Philip Wang
Invitation updated. Attendees: No attendees listed
Invitation updated. Attendees: Iosif Muntean, Flaviu Moldovan
Invitation updated. Attendees: Iosif Muntean, Philip Wang

What We've Learned Updated: Disc space

We had a remote connection with the customer in which we:
-Deleted the shadows from the backend of the server.
-Monitored the server resources since it is not accessible from the UI console.
-Advised the customer to set a Schedule Audit Log Backup for all the modules and retain only the last few months of logs on the server, after the server is accessible.

Next Steps Updated: Schedule a remote connection.

We will followup on Monday to see haw things are progressing.
